metadata.title: Quantum Computational Model of the Bardo Thödol: An Interdisciplinary Framework for Post-Mortem States
metadata.description: A quantum computational model integrating quantum mechanics, neuroscience, and Buddhist philosophy to model post-mortem consciousness states described in the Tibetan Book of the Dead. The model demonstrates that computational 'errors' (404/505) emerge as legitimate quantum vacuity states in qutrit systems.
references: Hameroff, S., & Penrose, R. (2014). Consciousness in the universe: A review of the 'Orch OR' theory.
Tegmark, M. (2000). Importance of quantum decoherence in brain processes.
Lutz, A., et al. (2004). Long-term meditators self-induce high-amplitude gamma synchrony.
Wallace, B. A. (2007). Contemplative Science: Where Buddhism and Neuroscience Converge.
Zurek, W. H. (2003). Decoherence, einselection, and the quantum origins of the classical.
